title: Woman reunited with lost iPhone that still works after 15 months in river
text:
Michael Bennett, left, found the iPhone under a rock while scuba diving (Picture: SWNS)

A woman’s iPhone was recovered from a river in working condition, a year after it went missing, meaning she was reunited with the final messages from her late father.

Erica Bennett, 39, lost her phone 15 months ago, after it fell into a river in South Carolina, US, during a river float trip in June 2018.

Her husband Jason Bennett, 49, a videographer and photographer, dived into the water to try and retrieve the phone, but couldn’t find it.

Erica was devastated when the device was gone, as it contained the last text messages from her father William Sikes.

William died from Leukamia the same month at the age of 63.

He had left Erica one last birthday message: ‘Happy Birthday baby!! Hope you are having a great one!!”

Erica, of Charleston, South Carolina, said: ‘That was one of the things that hit me hard.

The moment that Michael Bennett, 25, discovered that Erica Bennett’s iPhone he found on the riverbed still worked (Picture: Michael Bennett /SWNS)

‘I thought I would never be able to read those words again.

‘All I remember is thinking of all the photos and texts I had just lost in the bottom of that river. Memories I thought I would never get back.’

She was left stunned to receive a call a year later from Michael Bennett (no relation), telling her he had found her phone while he was scuba diving and it was in working condition.

Erica Bennett’s lost iPhone and case after recovery (Picture: Michael Bennett /SWNS)

Michael Bennett ,25, in his scuba gear (Picture: Michael Bennett /SWNS)

Michael found the phone on a Edisto River bed, in Ridgeville, South Carolina.

Michael, 25, said: ‘I have found hundreds of phones on my dives, but most of them do not turn on. I figured it would never work.’

Full-time YouTuber Michael took the iPhone home with him, plugged it into a charger and the device turned on.

Since he did not know the iPhone’s password, he removed the SIM card and inserted it into a different phone.

Erica Bennett, 39, was devastated when the phone containing the last text messages from her late father was lost in a river (Picture: Erica Bennett /SWNS)

Michael, of Charlotte, North Carolina, eventually found Erica’s cell phone number by retrieving her contacts, and gave her a call.

The personal trainer was getting into bed when she received his call on 22 September.

Erica said: ‘I thought it was a spam call at first.

‘It was unbelievable. I felt like I was getting punk’d.’

Erica with her late father William Sikes at her graduation (Picture: Erica Bennett /SWNS)

The last text messages from Erica Bennett’s late father on her recovered iPhone (Picture: Erica Bennett /SWNS)

The next day, Michael delivered the long-lost iPhone to Erica, reuniting her with the messages from her late father.

She said: ‘There were big waves of emotions. I felt really happy and relieved.’

Erica said the most important thing is that she can now read her father’s last words again.

She said: ‘I have those memories back now.

‘It’s just a phone. But then again, it’s not.’

description: Erica Bennett, 39, was reunited with her late father's final messages who had died of Leukamia.
